definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
clean/completely/only/net (income, exports etc)/(Chinese opera) painted face male role

sentences.english: Smoke from the camp-fires spiraled up into a clear sky.
sentences.chinese: 营火冒出的烟袅袅升上明净的天空。

sentences.english: See autumn cloud, I yearn for the vast clear sky vast.
sentences.chinese: 看秋云，我向往这浩渺明净的蓝天的广博。

sentences.english: The dark clouds will dissolve and peace and clarity will return.
sentences.chinese: 乌云将散去而和平与明净将回归。

sentences.english: Where the rivers run clear and the bracken is gold in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 这里，溪流清澈明净，水草在阳光下闪着金色的波光。

sentences.english: I am still talking here about energies which restrain you from achieving inner peace and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然在谈论那些阻止你获得内在和平与明净的能量。

sentences.english: White fragments of clouds were drifting across the sky.
sentences.chinese: 头上是冬天里明净的天空，片片白云飘过天际。

sentences.english: A canoe glides over the windowpane waters of Cypress Spring.
sentences.chinese: 一只小舟滑过柏树泉那明净的水面。

sentences.english: Between two dark sheds he caught a glimpse of the pure, starlit sky.
sentences.chinese: 在两间黑色的披屋之间，现出一片明净的星空。

sentences.english: I like the clarity of salt water.
sentences.chinese: 我爱这咸涩海水的清澈明净。

sentences.english: Get clean, clear, healthy-looking skin with NeutrogenaFacial Cleansing Bar for Acne-ProneSkin.
sentences.chinese: 露得清抗痘洁肤皂，给明净清透壮健的皮肤。

sentences.english: Facing death, be pure like the full moon.
sentences.chinese: 面对死亡，要有如空山圆月的明净。

definition: variant of 透徹|透彻[tou4 che4]
bright and beautiful/(of a landscape) gorgeous/(of a color) vibrant
pure and limpid/(of a person) quick-witted
see 一塵不染|一尘不染[yi1 chen2 bu4 ran3]
